column2: OREGON DMV PERMIT TEST
column6: OR

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column8: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.
column10: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 2. You are driving in the left lane and want to change to the right lane. Before changing lanes, you should check your mirrors, signal and:
column4: look over both shoulders for vehicles in front of you.
column6: look over your right shoulder.
column10: accelerate slightly before looking around your vehicle.

column2: 3. How many seconds ahead do experienced drivers scan the roadway for information that can reduce the driver's risks?
column6: 10 seconds ahead.

column2: 4. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive faster than the flow of traffic.
column6: drive with the flow of traffic.
column10: drive slower than the flow of traffic.

column2: 5. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column6: use alternate routes.
column10: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 6. When driving on major highways you should:
column6: be ready to react to road hazards.

column2: 7. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.
column6: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.
column8: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.

column2: 8. This sign means:
column6: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column8: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

column2: 9. Headlights must be turned on from sunset to sunrise. If you are using your high beams, you must dim your lights when an oncoming vehicle is within:
column6: 400 feet

column2: 10. The yield sign means:
column6: Go. The light will soon be red.
column10: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.

column2: 11. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column6: exceed the speed limit

column2: 12. This sign means:
column6: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column8: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column10: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.

column2: 13. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column6: Stop.

column2: 14. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column6: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column8: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column10: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.

column2: 15. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column6: Pull the steering wheel back.
column8: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 16. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column6: emergency flashers.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column6: No parking

column2: 18. This white sign means you:
column4: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.
column6: may turn left only on a green arrow.
column8: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.

column2: 19. Passing is prohibited:
column4: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.
column6: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.

column2: 20. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column6: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column8: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column10: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column6: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
column8: You must come to a complete stop
column10: You may proceed at regular speed through the intersection

column2: 22. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column6: possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 23. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: when you first see the exit sign.
column6: before moving into the exit lane.
column8: once you have moved into the exit lane.
column10: once you see the toll booth.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column6: No Bicycle zone

column2: 25. When an approaching driver at night blinds you by failing to dim their high beams, you should look:
column4: None of the other answers is correct.
column6: towards the right side of the road.
column8: towards the left side of the road.
column10: straight down the middle of the road.

column2: 26. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the left edge of the road.
column6: on the left shoulder of the road.
column8: near the right curb or edge of the road.

column2: 27. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column6: Sharp curve ahead
column8: Traffic flows only in the direction of the arrow

column2: 29. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column6: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
column8: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.

column2: 30. While driving, it is important to slow down:
column6: on narrow roads.

column2: 31. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column10: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column6: Trucks have the right of way

column2: 33. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column4: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column6: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column8: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.

column2: 34. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column4: They are hard to see in traffic.
column6: They always have the right-of-way.

column2: 35. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column6: an advance warning sign.
